On 9/1/05, maitrikaruna <kevin@...> wrote:
> not initializing=
 the neurons in the net seems strange to me.  if you
> have a simple net of=
:
> 
> NODE1-->NODE2-->NODE3
> 
> 1-->2 weight is .8
> 
> if NODE1 gets fir=
ed (the sensor on my agent keeps getting a reading
> from the world) at tim=
estep one, you would add .8 to NODE2's inputs.
> 
> When you read NODE1 aga=
in, and if its active again, then you add .8
> again to get 1.6.

Oh, I see=
 what you are doing...

Yes, each time you calculate the node, you calculat=
e the sum of its
inputs, apply the sigmoid, and set its output value.  You =
never
actually SAVE the sum of its inputs unless you are trying to do
somet=
hing fancy to reduce total amount of work required to calculate
and propaga=
te signals through the network.  So, in a way, you 'reset'
it because you r=
e-calculate the sum of the inputs from scratch every
timestep.

But you don=
't reset its OUTPUT with each timestep, no.

Make sense?
